member.summary: Gets or sets the item id. This id is used as the automation id for the corresponding control in the UI. The framework does not otherwise use or validate it. It is up to the application to set and use this id. The default value is null.

member.name: P:Autodesk.Windows.RibbonPanel.IsVisible
member.summary: If the value is true, the panel is enabled. If the value is false, the panel is disabled. When a panel is disabled all the items in the panel are disabled. The default value is true. To disable all panels in a tab use RibbonTab.IsPanelEnabled.

member.name: P:Autodesk.Windows.ToolBars.QuickAccessToolBarSource.IsMenuBarVisible
member.summary: Gets and sets the flag that indicates whether the menu bar is currently visible. This flag is used to adjust the context menu item that toggles the visibility of the menu bar.

member.name: P:Autodesk.Windows.ToolBars.QuickAccessToolBarSource.DefaultCommands
member.summary: Specifies the standard commands that are included in the quick access toolbar. By default, all of the standard commands are included.

member.name: P:Autodesk.Windows.ToolBars.QuickAccessToolBarSource.StandardCommands
member.summary: Exposes the enumerator for the standard commands collection of the quick access toolbar. The collection comprises the included default commands (New, Open, Save, Undo, and Redo) as well as any custom standard commands added by the client application.

member.name: P:Autodesk.Windows.ToolBars.QuickAccessToolBarSource.CustomizeVisibilityItems
member.summary: Returns an enumerator for the items on the quick access toolbar that can be shown or hidden through the toolbar customize menu. These are the standard commands specified by the application.

member.name: P:Autodesk.Windows.ToolBars.StatusBarSource.OverflowPopupPlacement
member.summary: Gets the placement of Popup controls in StatusBar which appear on the screen. By default all status bars place the overflow popup above the status bar. Derive from this class if another position is required.

member.name: P:Autodesk.Windows.ToolBars.StatusBarSource.CustomizeMenuPlacement
member.summary: Gets the placement of Customize Menu in StatusBar which appear on the screen. By default all status bars place the customization menu above the customization button. Derive from this class if another position is required.
